Script.name: win_group
Script.script:
-- This script creates an Adjustable Container window named "win_group" -- see: https://www.mudlet.org/geyser/files/geyser/AdjustableContainer.html
-- If you closed the window and want it to come back -- win_group:show() -- or lua win_group:show() from console input line
-- If you locked the container and want to be able to move/drag/resize it again -- win_group:unlockContainer() -- or lua win_group:unlockContainer() from console input
-- If you want to lock the container in place so you don't move/drag/resize it on accident -- win_group:lockContainer() -- or lua win_group:lockContainer() from console_input
win_group = win_group or Adjustable.Container:new({ name = "win_group", y = "0%", height = "10%", autoload = false, adjLabelstyle = "border:1px solid #458588;border-radius: 4px;background-color:black;", titleText = "Group" })
-- Put a console inside the window to write text to win_group_con_all = Geyser.MiniConsole:new({ name = "win_group_con_all", x = 0, y = 0, autoWrap = false, scrollBar = false, width = "100%", height = "100%", }, win_group)
win_group_con_all:setColor("black") -- set console background color setMiniConsoleFontSize("win_group_con_all",9) -- set console font size

Script.name: enableGroupMsdp
Script.script:
win_group = win_group or {}
-- register with Sloth that we want it to send us msdp.GROUP and CHARACTER_NAME function win_group.enableGroupMsdp() if not msdp then cecho("
") cecho("<firebrick>[<red>WARN<firebrick>]<reset> MSDP does not appear to be enabled on this Mudlet profile.
") cecho(" To enable: From Mudlet menu --> Options --> Preferences: Enable MSDP (check box)
") cecho(" You may need to reconnect Mudlet after enabling.
") end sendMSDP("REPORT","GROUP") sendMSDP("REPORT","CHARACTER_NAME") end

Script.name: msdpGroupWinHandler
Script.script:
-- each time Sloth sends an msdp.GROUP update, this function will be called to update the window function msdpGroupWinHandler()
-- msdp returns the group members in no order I understand so we'll assign points based on group position to help in sorting sortOrder = { [ [[Point]] ] = 60, [ [[Pleader]] ] = 60, [ [[Leader]] ] = 40, [ [[Front]] ] = 20, [ [[Back]] ] = 0, }
-- first clear the console since we're about to write the newest status of the group win_group_con_all:clear()
lastPos = nil -- used to insert blank lines between point, leader, front back (ie, on position changes)
-- iterate through each group member -- (using spairs to sort based on our made up sortOrder points + char levels) for _,v in spairs(msdp.GROUP,function(t,a,b) return (sortOrder[t[b].POSITION] or 0)+tonumber(t[b].LEVELS) < (sortOrder[t[a].POSITION] or 0)+tonumber(t[a].LEVELS) end) do
-- the following is not how i would normally do this but to make it self contained and easy to read
-- char name local name = string.format("%-12s",v.NAME, 12) -- highlight our own name if v.NAME == msdp.CHARACTER_NAME then name = "<:dark_slate_grey>"..name end
-- hp string local hp = string.format("%5s",v.HITPOINTS,5) local hpR = tonumber(v.HITPOINTS) / tonumber(v.MAX_HITPOINTS) local hpColor if hpR < .2 then hpColor = "<red>" elseif hpR < .8 then hpColor = "<orange>" else hpColor = "<green>" end
-- ma string local ma = string.format("%5s",v.MANA,5) local maR = tonumber(v.MANA) / tonumber(v.MAX_MANA) local maColor if maR < .2 then maColor = "<red>" elseif maR < .8 then maColor = "<orange>" else maColor = "<green>" end
-- mv string local mv = string.format("%4s",v.MOVES,4) local mvR = tonumber(v.MOVES) / tonumber(v.MAX_MOVES) local mvColor if mvR < .2 then mvColor = "<red>" elseif mvR < .8 then mvColor = "<orange>" else mvColor = "<green>" end
-- position string local pos = string.format("%8s",v.POSITION,8) local seperator = "" if lastPos ~= pos then lastPos = pos seperator = "\n" end
-- status, symbol and name color local symbol = " " local nameColor = "" local status = string.format("%10s",v.STATUS,10) local statusColor if (v.STATUS == "Standing") then statusColor = "<green>" elseif (v.STATUS == "Fighting") then statusColor = "<orange>" elseif (v.STATUS == "Dead") then statusColor = "<red>" nameColor = "<red>" symbol = "ðŸ’€" else statusColor = "<red>" -- if leading I want to see all green if moving end
-- put it all together to write the line win_group_con_all:cecho( seperator.. symbol.. nameColor.. name.."<reset>".. hpColor..hp.."<reset>hp ".. maColor..ma.."<reset>ma ".. mvColor..mv.."<reset>mv ".. pos.. statusColor..status.. "\n" ) end end
